data.title: About Regent Online
data.meta_description: Christ centered. Highly ranked. Accredited. Affordable. Pursue your degree online at Regent University. Learn about benefits, our transfer policy & more.
data.text:
Christ centered. Highly ranked. Accredited. Affordable.

With Regent University Online, you can pursue your degree while juggling your “day-to-day” activities. Here you enjoy the benefits of:

Our online degrees help you advance in your career, whether you’re a college student, working professionals or busy parent. Or all of these.

Choose from 150+ areas of study, designed with an eye on the global industry and most in-demand business sectors—including business, communication, cybersecurity and information technology, nursing and healthcare, education, psychology and counseling, ministry, government, and law.

Why Regent University Online?

Regent offers a transformative experience – nationally ranked academic programs, institutional accreditation, graduation rates ahead of the national average, and some of the most affordable tuition among private institutions. Here, you’ll be challenged to excel both in mind and spirit — to reach for personal excellence and change lives for the better.

Top National Universities, U.S. News & World Report, 2019, 2020 and 2022

#1 Best Accredited Online Schools, Study.com, 2020

#1 Best Online Bachelor’s Programs in Virginia for 10 years, U.S. News & World Report, 2022

One of only 24 universities nationally “A” rated for comprehensive liberal arts curriculum, American Council of Trustees and Alumni, 2022

Top 5% Most Affordable Private Christian Universities, CCCU Tuition Survey, 2018

Extraordinary Tailoring; Exceptional Support

At Regent, we offer up to eight start times a year, so you can start classes as soon as you’re ready! You’ll also enjoy a full menu of eight-week courses. Earn your degree at the pace that best fits your needs.

And select the program that best fits your calling. We believe in equipping you to excel, so we offer not just a spectrum of programs but also concentrations, so that you can specialize in the area that most interests you.
